name: cflow
description: 创建程序内的控制流图

options.description: set the depth at which the flowgraph is cut off

use given output format NAME; valid names are
`gnu' (default), `posix', and `dot'

include specified classes of symbols (see below);
prepend CLASSES with ^ or - to exclude them from
the output

_      symbols whose names begin with an
       underscore
s      static symbols
t      typedefs (for cross-references only)
x      all data symbols, both external and static
set output file name (default -, meaning stdout)
print reverse call tree
produce cross-reference listing only
prepend DIR to the profile search path
read options from FILE
don't load default profile
predefine NAME as a macro

add the directory DIR to the list of directories
to be searched for header files
rely on indentation
cancel any previous definition of NAME
accept only sources in ANSI C
run the specified preprocessor command
disable preprocessor
set initial token stack size to NUMBER

register SYMBOL with given TYPE, or define an
alias (if := is used); valid types are: keyword
(or kw), modifier, qualifier, identifier, type,
wrapper, or any unambiguous abbreviation thereof

show all functions, not only those reachable from
main
draw ASCII art tree
brief output
additionally format output for use with GNU Emacs
control graph appearance; see [1] for details

start graph at this function; multiple options
are allowed
print line numbers

there's no main function; print graphs for all
functions in the program

don't print argument lists in function
declarations
don't print symbol names in declaration strings

show only graphs leading from start symbols to
this function; multiple options are allowed
set debugging level
verbose error diagnostics
produce this help text
give a short usage message
print program version
